title: Barnwell's NFL quarter-season awards: The top candidates to win MVP, Rookie of the Year, more
content: Can Josh Allen win another MVP? Could anyone edge Myles Garrett for DPOY? We ranked the top three candidates to win seven NFL awards through four weeks.

title: Yamamoto puts L.A. in NLDS; Ohtani to start G1
content: Yoshinobu Yamamoto struck out nine to lead the Dodgers past the Reds and into the NLDS, where Shohei Ohtani will start the opener against the Phillies.

title: Jags' Walker has wrist surgery, could play vs. K.C.
content: Jaguars defensive end Travon Walker underwent left wrist surgery on Monday but there's a chance he could play against Kansas City on Monday night.

title: Pulisic, McKennie top U.S. roster for Oct. games
content: AC Milan attacker Christian Pulisic, Juventus midfielder Weston McKennie and Fulham defender Antonee Robinson highlight the 26-player roster named by United States manager Mauricio Pochettino for two friendlies in the October international window.

title: Chisholm turns page, saves Yanks to force Game 3
content: One day after he was benched, Jazz Chisholm turned in a season-saving performance for the Yankees, making a run-saving play with his glove and scoring the tiebreaking run in Wednesday's do-or-die Game 2 against the Red Sox.

title: Machado makes Cubs pay for Imanaga 'mistake'
content: Cubs manager Craig Counsell defended his decision to leave lefty Shota Imanaga in the game to face Padres slugger Manny Machado, who hit a two-run home run.

title: Colts' Howard abruptly retires, says 'family first'
content: Veteran cornerback Xavien Howard, 32, informed the Colts of his decision to retire just days after his much-criticized performance against the Rams.

title: Sources: Panthers' Mikkola gets $40M extension
content: The Florida Panthers have agreed to an eight-year extension with defenseman Niko Mikkola, and as a result have locked in each of their top four defensemen until at least 2030.

title: Sources: Big Ten mulling $2B private capital deal
content: The Big Ten is in talks about a private capital deal, which includes a 10-year grant of rights extension through 2046, that would infuse at least $2 billion into the league and its schools, sources told ESPN.

title: 📈 Ranking all 68 Power 4 QBs: A surprise No. 1
content: What have we learned about the signal-callers so far? Here's where Arch Manning, Beau Pribula and others stand.

title: MLB wild-card series: Who will stay alive in win-or-go-home Game 3s?
content: It's elimination Thursday with three winner-take-all games in the wild-card round! We've got it all covered for you.

title: WNBA Finals: Aces-Mercury predictions, preview, odds
content: A'ja Wilson's Aces seek their third title in four years. Phoenix is chasing its first since 2014. The Finals open Friday.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 5
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: A Dodgers  vs. Phillies NLDS?! Here's how each team can win it
content: The first division series is set! Here's how L.A. and Philly stack up for a clash of National League titans.

title: Knicks legends ride camels, 76ers go golfing: Top scenes from Abu Dhabi series
content: Here are the top scenes from Abu Dhabi as the Philadelphia 76ers and New York Knicks face off in a preseason doubleheader.

title: 'Can't complain; I'm liking life': Mitch Marner begins his Vegas era
content: The top free agent from the summer is ready to begin a new chapter with an elite Western Conference contender.

title: Bayern Munich, Atletico Madrid ... Qarabag? Making sense of Champions League MD2
content: Big clubs (Bayern Munich, Atletico Madrid) and small ones (FK Qarabag?!) shone on Champions League MD2 as several results made an impact on teams' chances of advancing. Let's break down the teams, matches and power ranking.

title: NFL kickoffs: Rules change results in most returns in history through Week 4
content: Here's a look at how the latest tweak to kickoffs resulted in yet another big jump in special teams action.

title: 10 NBA teams that gained -- or lost -- the most value in offseason deals
content: From trades to free agency to the draft, these teams will see boosts -- or declines -- from a summer of deals.

title: Wetzel: Collier comments reflect WNBA's core problem: How it sees Caitlin Clark
content: In seeming to not embrace the player who singlehandedly lifted the WNBA, the league risks losing her fan base.

title: Betting buzz: Ravens swing from favorite to underdog amid Jackson injury rumors
content: Amid speculation around Lamar Jackson's hamstring injury, the Ravens have swung from favorite to underdogs on Sunday.

title: College football betting: Buckeyes, Ducks the favorites for national title, Heisman
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and championship, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet them.

title: Tottenham takeover: Top scenes from Vikings-Browns in London
content: The NFL went international in Week 5. Here's how Minnesota and Cleveland made the trip worth remembering in London.

title: Boxing real or not: Gervonta Davis' future, Teofimo-Shakur, more
content: Andreas Hale on what's next for Gervonta Davis after Jake Paul, Terence Crawford's next move and more.

title: What Premier League pass maps tell us: Salah needs the ball, Man United rely on Shaw
content: The top Premier League teams have passed the ball in certain ways that betray either a weakness or a strength. What have we learned so far?

title: Every time Man United's Ruben Amorim has talked about his job
content: Ahead of a must-win match against Sunderland, here is everything Amorim has said about his job so far.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Como offer Man United's Zirkzee an escape
content: Manchester United forward Joshua Zirkzee is contemplating a move to Serie A side Como in January. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Which pitchers are MVPs, LVPs of 2025?
content: Eric Karabell looks back on the fantasy baseball season and hands out his MVPs and LVPs for pitchers.

title: Give me a reason to draft this guy! Late-round picks
content: When you're in the late rounds of your draft, here are the players you should look at and the key reason why.

title: Thaw in ties: India, China to resume direct flights by month-end
content: India and China are set to resume direct passenger flights by late October 2025, a significant move announced by the ministry of external affairs following technical discussions. This decision aims to restore normalcy in bilateral ties and expand people-to-people contact, contingent on commercial decisions and fulfilling operational criteria by designated carriers.

title: 'Those who ran ...': Uddhav's veiled jab at Shinde; calls BJP 'amoeba'
content: Uddhav Thackeray, at a Dussehra rally, jabbed at defectors as "brass" while calling loyalists "gold." He accused the BJP of 'vote chori' and communal politics, demanding central funds for rain-hit Maharashtra farmers. Thackeray also vowed to expose the BJP's alleged "loot" of the BMC if his party wins civic elections.

title: Controversy erupts! Pakistani commentator refers to 'Azad Kashmir' during match
content: Former Pakistan captain Sana Mir sparked outrage during the Women’s World Cup 2025 by referencing “Azad Kashmir” on air, leading to calls for her removal from the commentary panel for politicising sport. This controversy overshadowed Pakistan’s dismal performance, as they were restricted to 129 runs by Bangladesh’s disciplined bowling attack.

title: Microsoft leadership change: CEO freed from some duties - Read Nadella’s email to staff
content: Microsoft is reorganizing its top leadership, appointing Judson Althoff as CEO of Commercial Business to oversee marketing and operations. This strategic shift allows CEO Satya Nadella and engineering leaders to intensely focus on AI, data center expansion, and product development. The move aims to accelerate AI transformation and strengthen customer feedback loops across the company.

title: 'Get back, he has a bomb': Video of UK attack shows cops neutralise suspect; 2 dead
content: A violent attack outside a Manchester synagogue on Yom Kippur left two dead and three critically injured. Police confronted an armed man, with an officer heard shouting about a bomb during the evacuation. The incident, involving a car and stabbing, prompted the Prime Minister to condemn the assault and deploy additional security to UK synagogues.

title: Spying for Pak: Another YouTuber held; chats under lens
content: Haryana police arrested YouTuber Wasim Akram for allegedly spying for Pakistan's ISI and High Commission, providing SIM cards and communicating via internet calls. His arrest followed the detention of Taufiq, who implicated Akram. Both are now being interrogated as investigations continue, with more arrests anticipated.

title: IND vs WI: 'Had to take all four with hard work' – Siraj reacts after fiery spell floors Windies
content: Mohammed Siraj delivered a devastating four-wicket haul (4/40), dismantling West Indies for 162 on the opening day of the first Test. Excited by the green-top pitch, Siraj executed his wobble seam deliveries perfectly, including a standout dismissal. He credited confidence from the England series and emphasized the hard work required for his success.

title: Accenture job cuts: Company lays off thousands that can't be AI trained; what CEO said
content: Accenture has reportedly laid off thousands globally, citing employees' inability to retrain for AI roles. Despite these cuts, the company plans to expand its headcount next fiscal year, aggressively building AI capabilities and training over 550,000 staff. CEO Julie Sweet confirmed 'exiting' non-AI-aligned talent, reflecting a broader tech industry trend where adapting to AI is crucial for professional relevance.

title: JEE and NEET exams: Are they too tough for class 12 students? Experts analyse
content: The Centre has formed an expert panel to review whether the difficulty levels of JEE and NEET exams align with the class 12 curriculum. The panel is analysing data and feedback to address concerns about students’ heavy reliance on coaching centres. It will also examine gaps in schooling, awareness of career options, and the fairness of entrance tests. Recommendations may lead to changes aimed at reducing exam stress and coaching dependence.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; says X account won’t be updated until…
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years, as Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. This lapse halts "non-essential" functions like visa services and national parks, while essential employees work without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates to its X account.

title: Stephen Curry vs Killer Mike feud explained: Rapper apologizes, cites influence of drugs
content: Killer Mike apologized to Stephen and Ayesha Curry. This followed Stephen Curry calling out the rapper. Mike had previously mocked Ayesha Curry online. He claimed she embarrassed her husband. Mike admitted he was stoned during his initial remarks. He stated it was not his business. The rapper expressed regret for his comments. His family also reprimanded him.

title: Taliban FM to visit India next week? Amir Khan Muttaqi gets travel exemption
content: Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi has received a UN Security Council exemption for a landmark visit to India next week, marking the first high-level trip since the group took power in 2021. This visit follows increased Indian engagement through humanitarian aid and signals New Delhi's cautious approach to deepening ties while balancing international recognition concerns.

title: 'Wholesale attack on democracy in India': Rahul targets Centre, PM; BJP hits back
content: Rahul Gandhi, Leader of Opposition, accused the BJP-led central government of a “wholesale attack on Indian democracy” during an interaction in Colombia, emphasizing India's diverse traditions needing democratic space. The BJP hit back, calling him a “Leader of Propaganda” for denigrating Indian democracy abroad and wanting to "fight Indian state."

title: Unbelievable! Pak batter only second to suffer rare dismissal in Women's WC history
content: Pakistan's Nashra Sandhu became only the second player in Women's World Cup history to be dismissed hit wicket during their opening match against Bangladesh. This unusual exit contributed to Pakistan's struggle, as Bangladesh's disciplined bowling, spearheaded by Marufa and Nahida Akter, restricted them to a below-par 129 all out.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' row fallout: Bareilly on high alert, drones deployed; net suspended
content: Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly division is under heightened security for Dussehra, with drones and armed police deployed. Bareilly district faces a 48-hour internet suspension until October 4, following September 26 unrest. This measure aims to curb rumour-mongering and communal tension on social media. Four districts are on high alert, with officials warned against lapses.

title: Kai Trump faces backlash from Taylor Swift fans over Travis Kelce logo controversy
content: Kai Trump, Donald Trump's granddaughter, faces backlash from Taylor Swift fans over her new "KT" clothing line logo. Critics claim it closely resembles NFL star Travis Kelce's "Tru Kolors" brand, sparking a viral social media debate. Fans are questioning originality and potential legal issues, intensified by her family's political ties. Kai has yet to respond to the growing controversy.

title: IND vs WI: The double Gs! How Gill & Gambhir have all but freezed template of Playing XI
content: Shubman Gill captained India at home for the first time, revealing a consistent Test XI strategy. The team prioritises batting depth and all-rounders, now including Kuldeep Yadav for home conditions. This approach, featuring six bowling options, aims to establish a secure template, moving past the era of five specialist bowlers.

title: Aadhaar update charges hiked: Certain services cost more– check details
content: The UIDAI will introduce a revised fee structure for Aadhaar services starting October 1, 2025, with subsequent increases from 2028. Standard service fees will rise, for example, from Rs 50 to Rs 75 and Rs 100 to Rs 125. While certain biometric updates remain free, other updates and standalone demographic changes will incur higher charges.

title: Hughes vs Nurmagomedov 2: Rematch headlines PFL Dubai event
content: Paul Hughes is set for a highly anticipated rematch against the unbeaten lightweight champion Usman Nurmagomedov on 3rd October, 2025, in Dubai's Coca Cola Arena. Their first encounter was a dramatic and controversial affair, fueling expectations for this pivotal title fight. Streaming globally on DAZN, the event features a stacked card.

title: Shedeur Sanders responds to Rex Ryan's criticism after viral locker-room clip
content: Cleveland Browns rookie Shedeur Sanders went viral for a silent, mimed locker-room interview after Dillon Gabriel was named starter. This drew harsh criticism from Rex Ryan, but Sanders responded calmly, leaning on family support. The incident sparked debate about its meaning and media culture, with his parents publicly defending his actions.

title: Delhi, J'khand ... now Bihar: BJP plays 'infiltrators' card to corner oppn - will it work?
content: Bihar is witnessing a fierce political battle over "illegal migration," with Prime Minister Modi accusing the Mahagathbandhan of shielding foreign infiltrators. This offensive, a recurring BJP poll strategy, targets the opposition ahead of elections, particularly in the Muslim-majority Seemanchal region. While BJP officially cites development, the infiltration narrative aims to reshape electoral dynamics, echoing past campaigns in Delhi and Jharkhand.

title: UK synagogue attack: 2 dead, 3 hurt in mass stabbing; suspect shot by cops
content: Police declared a terrorist attack after an assailant drove a car into a crowd outside a UK synagogue. Two people died and three were seriously wounded during the incident on Yom Kippur. Officers shot and killed a suspect. Two arrests were made. UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer condemned the attack. King Charles III also expressed sorrow.

title: IND vs WI: Siraj, Bumrah rip through West Indies; KL Rahul slams fifty
content: India seized firm control of the opening day of the first Test against West Indies, bowling out the visitors for just 162, spearheaded by Mohammed Siraj and Jasprit Bumrah. KL Rahul then anchored India's response with an unbeaten half-century, guiding them to 121/2. India now trails by only 41 runs with eight wickets remaining, positioning them strongly for Day 2.

title: Captain’s faith: 'Even if you get out for 15 ducks' - how SKY backed Abhishek Sharma
content: Abhishek Sharma, Player of the Tournament in Asia Cup 2025, attributes his sensational form to captain Suryakumar Yadav's unwavering faith. Yadav assured him of his place despite early failures, transforming Abhishek's approach. He adopted an aggressive batting style, leading to a record 931 T20I rating points.

title: Aravind Srinivas named India’s youngest billionaire – who is he?
content: Chennai-born Aravind Srinivas, 31, has emerged as India's youngest billionaire, debuting on the M3M Hurun India Rich List 2025 with a net worth of Rs 21,190 crore from his AI startup Perplexity. His entry highlights a significant shift in India's wealth landscape, driven by young tech entrepreneurs in AI and digital platforms.

title: Gracie Hunt reflects on balancing NFL life with personal moments
content: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt experienced an unforgettable September, seamlessly blending high-stakes NFL games, international travel, and cherished personal moments. Despite a demanding schedule, she embraced every experience with gratitude, prioritizing connections with her boyfriend, family, and friends. Her journey exemplifies balancing professional ambition with heartfelt personal experiences, showcasing how intentionality transforms a busy life into a meaningful one.

title: Water cannons & global backlash: Israel stops 19 Gaza aid boats — How it all unfolded
content: The Israeli navy intercepted a pro-Palestinian flotilla, including Greta Thunberg, sailing towards Gaza to challenge an 18-year blockade. Activists faced water cannons and detention, sparking international condemnation from nations like Turkey and Colombia. Despite these actions, some vessels continue their mission to deliver symbolic aid and open a humanitarian corridor.

title: Asia Cup: 'Politics should stay aside' - AB de Villiers slams post-match chaos
content: South Africa cricket legend AB de Villiers criticised India's refusal to accept the Asia Cup trophy from the ACC President, urging a clear separation of sports and geopolitics, calling the ceremony awkward. He praised India's strong performance and composure throughout the tournament, highlighting Tilak Varma's crucial innings in their triumph.

title: 'Any misadventure ...': Rajnath flags Pak military build-up in Sir Creek; warns of ‘decisive response’
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh blamed Pakistan’s unclear intentions for the unresolved Sir Creek border dispute, warning of strong retaliation against any provocation. Citing Operation Sindoor, he praised India’s military strength in tackling threats, including Pakistan’s failed infiltration attempts. Singh stressed that while India has the power to respond forcefully, its actions remain focused on countering terrorism, not waging war.

title: MP: Teacher, wife bury newborn alive over 2-child policy fear; baby survives
content: A government school teacher and his wife in Madhya Pradesh allegedly buried their three-day-old son alive in a forest, fearing job loss under the state's two-child policy. The baby, their fourth child, miraculously survived after villagers rescued him. The couple now faces attempt-to-murder charges, revealing a tragic consequence of the policy and MP's high infant abandonment rates.

title: 'If my value isn't met': Ashwin on going unsold in ILT20 auction; reveals future plans
content: R Ashwin went unsold in the ILT20 2025 auction due to his $120,000 base price, stating he's content if his value isn't met. He has committed to playing the entire BBL 2025 season with Sydney Thunder, becoming the first high-profile Indian man to do so.

title: 'Mahatma Gandhi statue restored': London monument repaired after vandalism
content: The Mahatma Gandhi statue in London's Tavistock Square, recently vandalized, has been fully restored just in time for Gandhi Jayanti and the International Day of Non-Violence. Indian High Commissioner Vikram Doraiswami paid tribute, highlighting its significance for India-UK friendship and the enduring message of non-violence. The restoration symbolizes renewal after the defacement.

title: Fatty liver disease: Common leg symptom may be an early warning, doctor reveals
content: Fatty liver disease, particularly NAFLD, is a growing global concern largely driven by lifestyle factors. Gastroenterologist Dr. Pradip Vekariya highlights pedal edema, or swollen feet, as a crucial yet often-ignored early warning sign of liver damage. He stresses the importance of early detection through a simple pitting test to prevent the disease's progression and save lives.

title: 'Mock Taipei': China steps up Taiwan invasion plan; replica war zone triples in size
content: China has significantly expanded its mock Taipei government buildings at the Zhurihe Training Base, tripling its size since 2020. This includes replicas of key institutions and a symbolic tunnel, indicating intensified military preparations and urban warfare drills. Experts view this as refining invasion strategies and psychological warfare against Taiwan, demanding heightened vigilance.

title: Olivia Culpo's heartwarming toast to sister Aurora’s Paris engagement
content: Olivia Culpo celebrated her sister Aurora's engagement to Zac, announced via a dreamy Instagram post. This joyous occasion follows a period of family tension, now showcasing reconciliation and strong sibling bonds. With Olivia recently embracing motherhood, the Culpo family highlights a season of growth, love, and shared milestones for fans.

title: Bumrah sets new mark: Fastest Indian bowler to 50 Test wickets at home
content: Jasprit Bumrah became the fastest Indian to 50 Test wickets at home by balls bowled, reaching the milestone in 1,747 deliveries. He claimed 3/42, alongside Mohammed Siraj's 4/40, as India dismissed West Indies for 162. India now holds a commanding position in the opening Test.

title: 39 RSS men held in TN; Stalin govt says no permit for puja, 'shakha' training in school
content: Chennai Police detained 39 RSS members near Porur for holding a Guru Puja and special shakha training at a government school without permission. This detention coincided with the RSS centenary, which drew sharp criticism from Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, who condemned the central government's commemorative stamp and coin release.

title: US govt shutdown: How long will the deadlock continue; what to expect in coming days
content: The United States government has entered a shutdown after Congress failed to reach a spending agreement, triggering widespread disruption across federal agencies. Hundreds of thousands of federal workers face furloughs or delayed pay, while essential services continue without immediate compensation. The closure's duration is uncertain, with significant economic costs and a need for political compromise to resolve the deadlock.

title: Shivakumar warns party workers against CM post talk; KPCC told to issue notices
content: Karnataka deputy CM DK Shivakumar warned Congress leaders against discussing a change in chief minister, emphasizing his collaboration with CM Siddaramaiah and adherence to high command directives. This warning followed an MLA's public support for Shivakumar as future CM, prompting Siddaramaiah to reiterate his commitment to a full five-year term, denying any rotational agreement.

title: 'Zionists and RSS twin brothers': Kerala CM remarks on Sangh centenary
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan compared RSS to Zionists. He called them twin brothers. Vijayan criticized Prime Minister Modi over US H-1B visa fee hikes. He also questioned Modi's response to increased tariffs on Indian goods. The Chief Minister condemned the release of a postage stamp and coin for the RSS centenary. He stated this insulted the Constitution.

title: 'Assault' by actor Dimple: Maid flees Hyderabad flat with torn clothes after incident
content: Actress Dimple Hayathi and her husband David face police charges for allegedly harassing their 22-year-old domestic help. The complainant reported repeated abuse, denial of food, and humiliation. She further alleged David snatched and smashed her phone during an incident. Film Nagar police registered a case under relevant sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, and notices will be served for questioning.

title: WWE star Shane McMahon’s son Declan joins ESPN for summer internship
content: Declan McMahon, son of WWE's Shane McMahon, recently completed a summer internship at ESPN, signaling his growing interest in sports media beyond college football. This opportunity, revealed by Linda McMahon, could forge significant career connections, especially with WWE's new partnership with ESPN. Declan has also publicly supported his family's WWE legacy, hinting at a promising future bridging both industries.

title: 4 deaths in 2 days trigger protests in Punjab village; 20,000 FIRs in 7 mnths
content: Ferozepur's Lakho Ke Behram village is reeling after four young men died from alleged drug addiction in two days, sparking widespread outrage. Residents accuse the Punjab government and police of failing its "war against drugs," alleging easy drug availability and official inaction. Families shared harrowing tales of addiction's devastation.

title: Karur stampede: Why was Vijay not named as an accused, asks Thirumavalavan
content: “Why should the police file a case against four functionaries of the TVK and arrest two of them? On the other hand Mr. Vijay is being given security. Then, can we say that there is secret understanding between the DMK and Mr. Vijay?”

title: Thrissur comes alive with Vidyarambham ritual as children step into the world of letters
content: The ceremony, blending spirituality with cultural heritage, was celebrated at temples and institutions across the district

title: Old clothes to get a makeover at this training programme
content: Mithrakulam Charitable Trust in Ernakulam to train at least 10 people at their place on designing and creating unique products out of old clothes

title: Muslim girl performs Kathakali at Kerala Kalamandalam for the first time in 95 years
content: 16-year-old Sabri makes her debut in the Krishna ‘vesham.’ She joined the institution in 2023 and was taught the first ‘mudras’ by maestro Kalamandalam Gopi

title: ANRF’s SARAL tool to simplify scientific research papers
content: The Anusandhan National Research Foundation’s new tool will generate lay person summaries of complex scientific research, the science funding agency’s CEO said

title: Religious rites, ceremonial traditions mark Wadiyars’ Dasara
content: Unlike the State-sponsored festival, which is more of cultural events and sports, the Navaratri, as celebrated by the Wadiyars, entails rigorous observance of religious rites as prescribed in sacred texts under the supervision of trained priests

title: Gandhi adopting the principle of non-violence made him a Mahatma, says Shashil Namoshi
content: The BJP MLC was addressing a programme marking the 156th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi in Kalaburagi

title: Kannammoola-Nellikuzhy road work to be taken up soon
content: Residents of the area have been facing difficulties due to the road, which has been in a state of disrepair for a long time. Autorickshaw drivers as well as food delivery workers have generally been reluctant to venture into the road

title: Telangana second only to Karnataka in cyber crimes; Hyderabad among worst-hit metros
content: The State accounted for 21.1% of the 86,420 cyber cases reported across India, highlighting its position as the country’s epicentre of digital offences

title: Our objection is to survey enumerators seeking irrelevant information, says Joshi
content: The Union Minister says that the ongoing social and educational survey is being misused to encourage religious conversions among Hindus

title: 103 Maoists surrender in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur, get immediate assistance of ₹50,000 each
content: This was perhaps one of the largest-ever surrenders by Left-wing extremists in a single day in Chhattisgarh

title: Vigilance to grill sponsor in Sabarimala gold-plating scandal
content: Vigilance sleuths are preparing to interrogate Unnikrishnan Potti over his suspected role in several dubious deals by misusing his connections to the Sabarimala Ayyappa temple

title: Police claim Maoists killed former member for being ‘informer’
content: The victim had been arrested and imprisoned, after which he had severed ties with Maoists and had been living with his family, police said

title: A warrior of the wild and custodian of a tradition
content: Aged 59, this may have been the last Dasara of Abhimanyu though a final call will be taken by the authorities in due course

title: Dharwad Jamboo Savari drawing more and more crowds year after year
content: This year too, thousands witness the grand celebrations that mark the culmination of the Navaratri festival

title: FASTag annual pass sees demand, commuters seek wider coverage and inclusion of commercial vehicles
content: Introduced nationwide on August 15, 2025, the FASTag Annual Pass was designed by the Union government to ease the burden of frequent travellers on national highways

title: Credit for caste census by Union govt goes to RJD: Tejashwi Yadav
content: Mr. Yadav recalls the quota increase when he was Deputy CM; says RSS and BJP publicly doubted caste survey then

title: KPCC issues show-cause notice to Kunigal MLA H.D. Ranganath and former Mandya MP L.R. Shivarame Gowda for statements on leadership change
content: The Chief Minister on Wednesday, speaking on the sidelines of Dasara, reiterated he would complete a full five-year term

title: Rich tributes paid to Gandhi, Shastri on their birth anniversaries
content: Ministers, leaders of political parties, officials, professionals and students of schools and colleges in Kittur Karnataka take part in various functions

title: Proposed BrahMos Thiruvananthapuram unit transfer in line with provisions laid out in March 2007 Kerala government order on transfer of KELTEC, says Defence Minister
content: Resolution to transfer BrahMos Aerospace Thiruvananthapuram Ltd is in accordance with the extant provisions laid out in a Government of Kerala order dated March 22, 2007, says Rajnath Singh

title: Spectacular Jamboo Savari brings curtains down on Mysuru Dasara
content: People turned up in sizable numbers and stood to watch the grand spectacle unfolding on the Raja Marga – from the palace to Bannimantap – raising loud cheers, and capturing the sight in their mobile cameras

title: Watch | Karur stampede: Why Vijay can’t wash off responsibility | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: A tragic crowd stampede at Vijay’s TVK party rally in Karur claimed 41 lives. Actor-turned-politician Vijay has now responded to the incident. In this episode, we break down what the Karur tragedy reveals about Vijay’s approach and why his reaction is being closely watched.

title: ‘Translating Kumaravyasa’s classic Kannada Mahabharata Karnata Bharata Kathamanjari is a difficult task’
content: Harish Trivedi has spoken about translations and adaptations at the inaugural session of the five-day event. Krishnamurthy Hanuru and Rajendra Chenni have discussed the translation of Kumaravyasa Bharata into English

title: India, China to resume direct flights after five years
content: Indigo flights between Kolkata and Guangzhou will open for sale from October 3, 2025. Industry sources said that Air India too expects to start flights to Shanghai “before the end of the year”

title: T.N. natives died after inhaling toxic gas
content: They entered waste dump of a hotel at Kattappana on Tuesday night to clean it. Collector is understood to have recommended providing financial assistance to the families of the dead

title: Telangana prisons run below capacity as most of India battles overcrowding
content: Telangana’s prisons housed 5,853 inmates against a capacity of 8,037 in 2023, recording just 72.8% occupancy, far below India’s overcrowded average, latest NCRB data reveals

title: FIR lodged over circulation of Ladakh DGP's deepfake video
content: The PIB has said the video, in which DGP S.D. Singh Jamwal is purportedly seen claiming that climate activist Sonam Wangchuk was arrested on the defence minister's directions, is deepfake

title: Technical gaps, outdated income norms put Karnataka’s poor at risk of BPL exclusion
content: The State government has intensified its crackdown on bogus cards and ineligible beneficiaries, with the broader aim of dismantling the collusion between fair price shop owners and those who create fake cards

title: One can say ‘I love Modi’ but not ‘I love Muhammad’ in India: Owaisi
content: “What do you want to make of this country? If I am Muslim, it is because of Muhammad sallallaahu alayhi wa sallam. There is nothing before and after this”

title: NCRB report: Telangana crimes make up 2.9% of India’s total in 2023
content: At the city level, Hyderabad accounted for 25,749 cases in 2023, making up 2.7% of crimes reported across 19 major metropolitan cities

title: Madhya Pradesh urges Supreme Court that 50% quota cap is ‘flexible’, can be overlooked in ‘special situations’
content: SC to hear validity of Madhya Pradesh law which enhances OBC quota from 14% to 27%, breaking the 50% reservation ceiling established by the court in the Mandal Commission case judgment in 1992

title: BJP slams Rahul Gandhi for his remarks at seminar in Colombia
content: Rahul Gandhi does it again, degrades India on foreign soil. From defaming our democracy in London, to mocking our institutions in the US, now in Colombia he spares no chance to insult Bharat globally, says BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia

title: Murder charge slapped on Zubeen Garg's manager, festival organiser: Assam Police
content: “The investigation is going on, and I cannot share much detail. We have added Section 103 of the BNS in the FIR now,”Special DGP of Assam Police’s CID said

title: BJP leader threatens retaliation after Cherukkunnu bomb attack
content: March taken out to protest against the pre-dawn bomb attack on BJP Kalliasseri constituency committee general secretary K. Biju Narayanan’s house

title: PHC doctors’ strike: A.P. govt. agrees to provide quota for in-service candidates in all clinical branches
content: The PHC doctors, who suspended all services, both outpatient and emergency, at all PHCs in Andhra Pradesh from Monday, demanded that the quota finalised for them in admissions into PG courses for the year 2025-26 be reconsidered

title: Karnataka got lion’s share in NMC’s medical seat enhancement this year
content: This year, the NMC sanctioned additional seats to 808 medical colleges across India, out of which a total of 900 additional seats have been made available to 16 medical colleges in Karnataka

title: Renowned Gandhian G.G. Parikh passes away at 101
content: G.G. Parikh was a Gandhian, a freedom fighter, an upholder of democratic socialism, and a builder of labour movements and passed away on October 2, 2025

title: Wholesale attack on democratic system in India: Rahul at Colombia university
content: I am very optimistic about India, but at the same time, there are fault lines within the Indian structure, there are risks that India has to overcome, says Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi

title: Kerala Water Transport department to launch Kuttanad Safari eco-tourism boat service by November
content: An amphitheatre to be constructed on Pathiramanal island. To promote eco-friendly and responsible tourism, the amphitheatre will be built using sustainable materials such as grass and bamboo

title: 114 Odisha police job aspirants arrested while travelling to collect question paper in advance
content: Former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik said these repeated disruptions highlighted a troubling pattern in Odisha’s recruitment system, undermining trust and affecting lakhs of job seekers across the State

title: Kalaignar TV moves Madras High Court against income tax proceedings related to 2G spectrum case
content: Questions the authority of an Assistant Director of Income Tax (Investigations) to conduct an inquiry during the pendency of appeal proceedings

title: Illegal marriage hall on pond land demolished in Sambhal; committee given 4 days for mosque removal
content: Tehsildar Dhirendra Pratap Singh said the demolition of the marriage hall was ordered by his court, along with the removal of the illegally-constructed mosque on reserved land

title: Electronics component manufacturing scheme receives 249 applications: IT Ministry
content: “Around double the expected investment commitments have been received in applications for the Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme,” IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said

title: BJP ‘playing politics’ over Karur tragedy, alleges TNCC president Selvaperunthagai
content: Mr. Selvaperunthagai criticised the BJP for forming an eight-member committee led by Lok Sabha MP, Hema Malini, contending she did not know even the north from south of Karur

title: Pan City LED Street Light project inaugurated in Kochi; Opposition challenges claims of better power efficiency
content: Under the project, conventional street lights have been replaced with over 40,000 smart and energy-efficient LED lights within Kochi Corporation limits

title: T.N. CM Stalin instructs officials to ensure facilities for paddy procurement, storage
content: Mr. Stalin held a meeting with collectors of five delta districts and officials of the Co-operative and Civil Supplies and Consumer Protection Department

title: Ramadoss appoints Tamil Kumaran as PMK youth wing president
content: Addressing a press conference at his Thailapuram residence, Mr. Ramadoss said months ago, he had previously appointed Mr. Kumaran to the post but Mr. Anbumani asked Mr. Kumaran to resign from the post immediately

title: Auto ‘Driverla Sevalo’ programme will be launched on October 4: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: CM Chandrababu Naidu said the ₹15,000 financial assistance scheme would be extended to nearly 2.9 lakh auto drivers whose income has dropped with the introduction of free bus scheme

title: Police department not under T.N. CM Stalin’s control, alleges Nainar Nagenthran
content: Referring to a recent incident of sexual assault on a teenager by two policemen in Tiruvannamalai, he alleged that several instances of police excesses had taken place in the State since the DMK came to power

title: Wayanad rehabilitation: Centre discriminating against Kerala, says K.C. Venugopal
content: Congress MP points out that though Kerala had sought a package of ₹2,219 crore, the Centre allocated only ₹260.56 crore

title: Heavy Rains Predicted As Deep Depression Forms Over Bay Of Bengal
content: A deep depression over the Bay of Bengal is very likely to bring heavy to very heavy rainfall in several districts of West Bengal till October 6 morning, as various parts of the state witnessed showers on Thursday

title: 2 Men Charged With Human Trafficking Via Dunki Route To US
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has chargesheeted two men for involvement in the illegal human trafficking from India to the US via the dunki' route, officials said on Thursday.

title: Everybody In Washington Hates A Shutdown. Until You're Pushing For One
content: The US government had shut down, and Donald Trump was calling on Democrats and Republicans to work together to get out of the mess.

title: 10 Children Among 13 Killed During Durga Immersion In Madhya Pradesh
content: Two accidents during the immersion of idols of Goddess Durga in Madhya Pradesh left at least 13 people dead on Thursday, including ten children.

title: Delhi Baba's Women Aides Arrested, Have Confessed To Pressuring Students: Cops
content: Three women aides of Delhi Baba, who has been accused of sexually harassing at least 17 students at a private institute in Delhi, have been arrested.

title: Interstellar Comet Swinging Past Mars As A Fleet Of Spacecraft Looks On
content: A comet from another star system will swing by Mars on Friday as a fleet of spacecraft trains its sights on the interstellar visitor.

title: Strange 'Rogue' Planet Spotted Guzzling Matter Like A Star
content: A mysterious "rogue" planet has been observed gobbling six billion tonnes of gas and dust a second -- an unprecedented rate that blurs the line between planets and stars, astronomers said.

title: 'Low-Speed Collision' Between 2 Jets At New York's LaGuardia Taxiway
content: Two Delta Air Lines regional jets collided on the taxiway at LaGuardia Airport in New York, injuring a flight attendant, damaging a cockpit and tearing off part of a wing in what the airline described as a "low-speed collision."

title: 'Siddaramiah Will Remain Chief Minister For Full 5 Years': Karnataka Minister
content: Senior Congress leader and Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara on Thursday said that Chief Minister Siddaramaiah will remain in the post for the full five years term.

title: Video Shows UK Police Shooting Manchester Synagogue Attack Suspect
content: Two people were killed and three injured in a car ramming and mass stabbing incident in Manchester, in northwest England, on Thursday.

title: 2 Killed In Shooting at UK Synagogue, Cops Call It "Terror Attack"
content: Manchester Stabbing Attack: Two people were killed and three critically wounded after a car was driven into members of the public followed by a stabbing attack outside a synagogue near UK's Manchester.

title: Delhi Baba Gave Separate Rooms To Targeted Women, Took Away Phones: Ex-Student To NDTV
content: He may be facing a raft of cases only now, but the Delhi baba arrested for sexual harassment had been harassing his students even nine years ago, a former learner at his institute has said.

title: White House Says Firings 'Imminent' As Plan To Reopen US Government Collapses
content: Efforts to swiftly end the US government shutdown collapsed Wednesday as Democrats in Congress went home without resolving a funding stand-off with President Donald Trump and the White House threatened public sector jobs.

title: 103 Maoists Surrender In Chhattisgarh, Get Rs 50,000 As Rehabilitation Package
content: As many as 103 Maoists, 49 of them carrying a collective bounty of more than Rs 1 crore, surrendered before authorities in the Bijapur district of Chhattisgarh on Thursday, a police official said.

title: DJs, Pickleball, Trump Jr: Crypto Conference In Singapore Sees Huge Attendance
content: From making predictions about a multi-trillion stablecoin market to praising US President Donald Trump for his support of the crypto industry, a high-profile conference in Singapore this week added to the buoyant mood in the industry.

title: Final-Year BTech Student Dies By Suicide In IIT-Kanpur: Cops
content: A student of the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) here was found dead in his hostel room, after other students complained about a foul smell, police said on Thursday.

title: Unharmed As Others Collapsed, 200-Foot Raavan Effigy To Be Set Ablaze
content: Standing tall as others collapsed in the rain, a unique Raavan effigy in Rajasthan's Kota will be set afire on Thursday evening to celebrate Dussehra.

title: 2 Tamil Nadu Cops Dismissed From Service For Alleged Gang Rape Of Andhra Woman
content: Two constables of the Tamil Nadu police have been dismissed from service for the alleged gang-rape of a young woman from Andhra Pradesh.

title: India, China Reach Agreement, Direct Flights To Begin On October 26
content: India and China have agreed to resume direct air services by the end of this month, following sustained discussions between the civil aviation authorities.

title: 'Over 100 Years, We Resisted Greed, Focused On Character Building': RSS Chief
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Thursday said the Sangh, despite being lured by greed and invited to join politics, has stuck to its core mission of 'vyakti nirman' (character building) for the past 100 years.

title: Pereira was on the wrong side of UFC title history once; will that happen again?
content: ankalaev-Pereira 2 will be the first bout for both fighters since the belt changed hands . pereira dethroned pereira when they met in march . he will be aiming to regain the light heavyweight title on saturday .

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .
